publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-569# Christine May: Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industryâ€”That the Parliament recognises the outstanding economic potential presented by the renewable energy industry, not only in the field of wind power but also through other forms of energy such as biomass and wave power and further recognises that, if the Scottish Executive is to meet all of its renewable energy targets, it needs to do all it can to encourage all forms of renewable energy so that the market is there to support future projects. Supported by: Bill Butler*

S2M-569# Christine May: Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry-That the Parliament recognises the outstanding economic potential presented by the renewable energy industry, not only in the field of wind power but also through other forms of energy such as biomass and wave power and further recognises that, if the Scottish Executive is to meet all of its renewable energy targets, it needs to do all it can to encourage all forms of renewable energy so that the market is there to support future projects. Supported by: Bill Butler
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Mr Richard Baker*

S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Margaret Jamieson*, Scott Barrie*, Rhona Brankin*, Robert Brown*, Maureen Macmillan*, Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Pauline McNeill*, Marlyn Glen*, Colin Fox*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Karen Gillon*, Cathie Craigie*, Robin Harper*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Shiona Baird*, Alex Neil*, Iain Smith*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Bristow Muldoon*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Irene Oldfather*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Sarah Boyack*

S2M-569# Christine May: Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry-That the Parliament recognises the outstanding economic potential presented by the renewable energy industry, not only in the field of wind power but also through other forms of energy such as biomass and wave power and further recognises that, if the Scottish Executive is to meet all of its renewable energy targets, it needs to do all it can to encourage all forms of renewable energy so that the market is there to support future projects. Supported by: Bill Butler, Mr Richard Baker, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Margaret Jamieson, Scott Barrie, Rhona Brankin, Robert Brown, Maureen Macmillan, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Pauline McNeill, Marlyn Glen, Colin Fox, Mr Mark Ruskell, Karen Gillon, Cathie Craigie, Robin Harper, Karen Whitefield, Shiona Baird, Alex Neil, Iain Smith, Ms Sandra White, Bristow Muldoon, Marilyn Livingstone, Irene Oldfather, Donald Gorrie, Cathy Peattie, Sarah Boyack
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-569# Economic Potential of the Renewable Energy Industry (lodged on 6 November 2003) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
